00001 /*
00002  *  maven Programming Language
00003  *  Created by Elliot Chance <elliot@chancemedia.com>.
00004  */
00005 
00006 #include "maven.h"
00007 #include "struct_MavenCompiler.h"
00008 #include "struct_MavenObject.h"
00009 #include "strings.h"
00010 #include "errors.h"
00011 #include "objects.h"
00012 
00013 bool pushObject(MavenCompiler* c, int namespaceID, MavenObject* obj) {
00014         // validate
00015         smartAssert(namespaceID >= 0);
00016         smartAssert(namespaceID < c->namespaces->length());
00017         smartAssert(obj != 0);
00018         
00019         // Because Object and String require each other, they were pushed manually when the compiler was
00020         // created, and hence when we come across these we have to assume the user is not doing something
00021         // naughty. This probably should be looked at some time in the future.
00022         if(c->currentNamespace == "maven")
00023                 if(obj->name == "Object" || obj->name == "String") return true;
00024         
00025         int objectID = findObjectID(c, namespaceID, obj->name);
00026         if(objectID >= 0) {
00027                 // bug #35: obj.line shows the new line not the original definition
00028                 pushError(c, "Class %s already defined (previously defined at line %s)", obj->name,
00029                                   intToString(obj->line));
00030                 return false;
00031         }
00032         
00033         // push class
00034         c->namespaces->at(namespaceID).objects->push(obj);
00035         
00036         // push discovery, so the classes can be mapped back in the same order
00037         c->discovery.push_back(MavenObjectDiscovery(namespaceID,
00038                                                                                                 c->namespaces->at(namespaceID).objects->length() - 1));
00039                                                                                 
00040         return true;
00041 }
